newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late rubber firm on deals, Tokyo gains.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late rubber firm on deals, Tokyo gains.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber offer prices were firm in late trading, with sentiment bolstered by purchases and gains in Tokyo, traders said.
They said October shipment SIR20 was done at 44.00 cents/lb fob Palembang, while November rubber was done at 44.125 cents fob Medan. The buyers were Singapore-based dealers.
"Some deals were done in Palembang and Medan, although the overall market was quiet," one trader said. "The gains in Tokyo today, I think, helped pull in the buyers."
Tokyo futures ended higher across the board on Friday, helped by the Japanese currency's weakness against the dollar and higher prices for other commodities in the country.
Traders said they expected Indonesian prices to be steady next week on improved demand, but added that they only expected values to improve significantly after the summer holidays.

Traders said September SIR20 offers were quoted at 44.00 cents/lb fob Medan, and at 44.25 cents for October, 43.75-43.875 cents fob Palembang and Surabaya, 43.50 cents fob Padang and 43.25 cents fob Pontianak and Jambi.
